description: The DEA is looking for candidates to grow marijuana for research – but will it find any takers?
extended: Wanted: Someone to grow marijuana for the federal government. Benefits: A contract likely worth millions and the chance to enable medical research. Requirements: Ability to deal with the costs and regulations that come with growing an illegal drug for the federal government.

description: Confessions of an ex-Facebook trending news curator: 'They are just going to get rid of the product altogether' - Digiday
extended: Barely two days after changes to its Trending Topics section, a fake article about Fox News anchor Megyn Kelly began trending on Facebook — before entirely disappearing on Monday morning.

description: Here's How People Are Actually Using Bitcoin | VICE | United States
extended: Bitcoin is a cipher—literally and figuratively.

description: Discrimination by Design - ProPublica
extended: This story was co-published with Source. A few weeks ago, Snapchat released a new photo filter. It appeared alongside many of the other such face-altering filters that have become a signature of the service.

description: WEEDIQUETTE - Timeline | Facebook
ABC Nabs Zach Braff Comedy ‘Start Up’ As Put Pilot | Deadline
extended: EXCLUSIVE: Scrubs star Zach Braff is returning to series television and to ABC as the star of Start Up, a single-camera comedy, which has received a put pilot commitment.

description: Here's How Desiigner, Amber Rose, Fat Joe, and More Celebrities Feel About Young Thug's 'Jeffery' Cover Art | Complex
extended: Hip-hop fans have not hesitated in sharing their opinions about Young Thug's Jeffery cover art, which finds him wearing a frilly, purple dress and hat.

description: www.nytimes.com
extended: This summer, I went on a 30-city tour with my movie “Don’t Think Twice,” a comedy about an improv group that has to decide whether to stay in show business when one member is plucked for a “Saturday Night Live” type of show. At every Q. and A.

description: www.nytimes.com
Tens of Thousands of Infowars Accounts Hacked | Motherboard
extended: Tens of thousands of subscriber accounts for media company Infowars are being traded in the digital underground. Infowars, created by famed radio host and conspiracy theorist Alex Jones, produces radio, documentaries and written pieces.

description: Wolff: The looming shakeout in digital media
extended: Not too long ago, a senior figure at BuzzFeed told me at a private lunch that although BuzzFeed was going strong, everybody else in digital media was screwed.

description: Study shows LSD’s effects on language and speech
extended: Lysergic acid diethylamide, or LSD, is a synthetic drug that has been abused for its hallucinogenic properties since the 1960s. LSD can produce visual hallucinations and delusions that affect the consumer’s perception of time and identity.

description: Adactio: Journal—Why do pull quotes exist on the web?
extended: There you are reading an article when suddenly it’s interrupted by a big piece of text that’s repeating something you just read in the previous paragraph. Or it’s interrupted by a big piece of text that’s spoiling a sentence that you are about to read in subsequent paragraphs.

description: How camping technology made us feel at home in nature | The Verge
extended: The National Park System is turning 100, and The Verge is celebrating with Wilderness Week: a look at the natural world, its freaky critters, and its future. I used to think of camping trips as a time to disconnect from society.

description: AJ+ - Timeline | Facebook
Ezra Klein - Timeline | Facebook
Kickstarter - Timeline | Facebook
Meet Monero, the Currency Dark Net Dealers Hope Is More Anonymous Than Bitcoin | Motherboard
extended: Not even bitcoin is anonymous enough for some criminals on the dark net. For years, the cryptocurrency has been the payment method of choice for people buying and selling drugs and other illegal items on the dark net.

description: BuzzFeed splits news, entertainment units in reorganization - Aug. 23, 2016
extended: Staking its future on video, BuzzFeed has announced that it will split into two units: a new, video-focused BuzzFeed Entertainment Group and BuzzFeed News.

description: John Tang of FRONTEER on How to Make a Sneaker | HYPEBEAST
extended: If you’ve already conquered the task of screen printing t-shirts, what’s the next step? Designing sneakers of course. To aid in this challenge John Tang, creative director of FRONTEER, explains the intricacies involved when designing and making a sneaker from scratch.

description: The Narcissism of One-Sided Romantic Obsession | Broadly
extended: "I could tell you in the vaguest of terms that I have an academic book project that I'm working on that was sparked by an offhand remark made on Twitter by a woman I nearly slept with on June 28, 2013, who then refused to ever speak with me again and I'll never know why.

description: 15minutes.inthemorni.ng
extended: I love Apple Notes, and it’s now a central part of my life.

description: 'I’m not paranoid': These Americans are doing more that just stockpiling food and ammunition. | The Washington Post
extended: Don and Jonna Bradway recently cashed out of the stock market and invested in gold and silver.

description: Playing WWII Sim ‘Hearts of Iron IV’ Makes the Modern World Look Like It’s On the Brink | VICE | United Kingdom
extended: A spectre is haunting Europe – the spectre of fascism. Or maybe it's the spectre of terrorism, nativism, Russian irredentism, or any number of other unpleasant isms.

description: How Chance the Rapper's Life Became Perfect | GQ
extended: At just 23, Chance The Rapper has already earned the love and respect of his elders, like Kanye West, who let him lead off on The Life of Pablo, and his musical peers, who hear a generational voice in his third mixtape, Coloring Book.

description: How We Rebuilt the Wall Street Journal’s Graphics Team - Features - Source: An OpenNews project
extended: The Wall Street Journal recently took steps to merge our print graphics department with our interactive team. Our new team is simply named Graphics. Many other organizations are undergoing similar changes.

description: 4Chan Poster Gloriously Interrupts Clinton Alt-Right Speech | We Are Change
extended: As Democratic candidate Hillary Clinton gave a speech in Reno attempting to smear the millions of people who support her opponent Donald Trump as racist monsters — 4chan was in the building to gloriously troll the low-energy event.
